page_analysis.text_content:
Noise-producing equipment site planning

• May not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
• May encroach into street-side yard up to 6' (Fig 27 C below)
• All service equip. must meet the City's Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of
the Municipal Code.

• Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section where feasible.
• Must be insulated and housed, however, Planning Dept. can waive this
requirement if equipment is located in buildable area and a combination
of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will
assure compliance with the City's Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.

Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

A Pool equipment
• Pool equip. is within buildable area even though
there is room for it behind the
garage/poolhouse in the required rear yard.
• Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-
theway niche maintaining the required 10' min.
clearance for the driveway

B Pool equipment & AC unit
• Pool equip. is located within buildable area even
though there is room for it next to the poolhouse
in the required rear yard.
• Air conditioning equip. is located within build-
able area behind the house. There is not enough
room along the interior side of the house.

C Generator & AC unit
• Air conditioning equip. is located in street
side yard in compliance with the regula-
tions. Note that it may not encroach into
the front or rear yards.
• Generator is located within buildable area.

visual_elements.description: A site plan diagram showing three different examples (A, B, C) of noise-producing equipment placement on residential lots. Each example illustrates a main dwelling, various yards (front, rear, interior-side, street-side), a buildable area, and the placement of specific equipment (Pool equip., AC equip., Generator). The diagram includes setback lines and lot lines. A key is provided to define symbols and shaded areas.

Example A: Site plan showing a 'Combo garage / small poolhouse' in the rear yard, a 'Main dwelling', and a 'Pool equip.' (P) located within the buildable area behind the garage/poolhouse. An 'Air conditioning equip.' (AC) is located in an out-of-the-way niche in the interior-side yard, maintaining a 10' minimum clearance from the driveway. The lot has front, rear, and interior-side yards.
visual_elements.location: Bottom-left of the page, part of the larger diagram

visual_elements.description: Example B: Site plan showing a 'Main dwelling', a '2-car attached garage', and a 'Larger poolhouse' in the rear yard. A 'Pool equip.' (P) is located within the buildable area next to the poolhouse. An 'Air conditioning equip.' (AC) is located within the buildable area behind the house, along the interior side of the house. The lot has front, rear, and interior-side yards.
visual_elements.location: Bottom-middle of the page, part of the larger diagram

visual_elements.description: Example C: Site plan showing a 'Main dwelling', a 'Garage', and a 'Generator' (G) located within the buildable area. An 'Air conditioning equip.' (AC) is located in the street-side yard, encroaching up to 6' maximum into the street-side yard. The lot has front, rear, interior-side, and street-side yards.
visual_elements.location: Bottom-right of the page, part of the larger diagram

visual_elements.description:
Legend for the site plan diagram, defining line types and shaded areas:
- Solid line: Curb
- Dashed line: Lot line
- Patterned rectangle: Sidewalk
- Long dashed line: Required setbacks
- Light grey shaded area with dashed border: Buildable area
- Dark grey shaded area: Dwelling/parking
- 'P' in a black square: Pool equip.
- 'AC' in a black square: Air conditioning equip.
- 'G' in a black square: Generator

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum clearance for driveway (AC equip. in Example A)

sections: Fig 27 Examples of site planning solutions for noise-producing equipment

additional_notes: Page number '33' is located at the bottom right corner.

qualifiers.text: however, Planning Dept. can waive this requirement if equipment is located in buildable area and a combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering will assure compliance with the City's Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.
even though there is room for it behind the garage/poolhouse in the required rear yard.
maintaining the required 10' min. clearance for the driveway
even though there is room for it next to the poolhouse in the required rear yard.
There is not enough room along the interior side of the house.
Note that it may not encroach into the front or rear yards.

conditions.text: May not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
May encroach into street-side yard up to 6'
All service equip. must meet the City's Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code.
conditions.threshold_value: City's Noise Ordinance in Chapter 9.10 of the Municipal Code

conditions.text: Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section
Pool equip. is within buildable area
Air conditioning equip. is located in an out-of-theway niche
Pool equip. is located within buildable area
Air conditioning equip. is located within buildable area behind the house.
Air conditioning equip. is located in street side yard
Generator is located within buildable area.

logical_relationships.expression: IF (equipment is located in buildable area AND (noise specifications OR location OR other screening OR buffering assures compliance with City's Noise Ordinance at nearest lot line)) THEN Planning Dept. can waive c5 ELSE c5 must be met.

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate general location restrictions for noise-producing equipment.
Ensure all service equipment meets noise ordinance requirements.
Evaluate insulation and housing requirements, with potential waiver.
Evaluate specific conditions for 'A Pool equipment'.
Evaluate specific conditions for 'B Pool equipment & AC unit'.
Evaluate specific conditions for 'C Generator & AC unit'.
